briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety Study of Kedrion IVIG 10% to Treat Subjects With Primary Immunodeficiency (PID)
officialTitle: Multicenter, Open-label, Historically Controlled, Phase III Study to Assess the Efficacy, Tolerability, Safety and Pharmacokinetics of Kedrion IVIG 10% in Adult and Pediatric Subjects With Primary Immunodeficiency (PID).
summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether Kedrion IVIG 10% (an immunoglobulin solution) is effective in treating Primary Immunodeficiency (PID).

primaryOutcome.measure: Incidence of Acute, Serious Bacterial Infections in the Total ITT Population.

effectByArm.arm: Kedrion IVIG 10% 21 and 28 Days Infusion Schedule
